title: When do Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz play their first matches at Roland Garros?
description: Top seed Jannik Sinner and defending champion Carlos Alcaraz will both play their opening Roland Garros matches on Monday, Day 2 of this year’s tournament. World No. 1 Sinner will play Frenchman Arthur Rinderknech, who is No. 72 in the PIF ATP Rankings. The 29-year-old did beat Sinner in their lone clay-court meeting in Lyon in 2021, but the Italian leads their Lexus ATP Head2Head series 2-1. Alcaraz will play Italian lucky loser Giulio Zeppieri, who replaced the injured Kei Nishikori on line 127 of the draw. Day 1 play on Sunday will feature Lorenzo Musetti, Tomas Machac, Frances Tiafoe, Ben Shelton and Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Find out when Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will open their campaigns at Roland Garros.
text: Sinner faces Rinderknech, Alcaraz plays Zeppieri May 24, 2025 Dan Istitene/Getty Images Jannik Sinner will play his opening Roland Garros match on Monday. By ATP Staff Top seed Jannik Sinner and defending champion Carlos Alcaraz will both play their opening Roland Garros matches on Monday, Day 2 of this year’s tournament. World No. 1 Sinner will play Frenchman Arthur Rinderknech, who is No. 72 in the PIF ATP Rankings. The 29-year-old did beat Sinner in their lone clay-court meeting in Lyon in 2021, but the Italian leads their Lexus ATP Head2Head series 2-1. Alcaraz will play Italian lucky loser Giulio Zeppieri, who replaced the injured Kei Nishikori on line 127 of the draw. html:
Sinner faces Rinderknech, Alcaraz plays Zeppieri

May 24, 2025

Dan Istitene/Getty Images

Jannik Sinner will play his opening Roland Garros match on Monday. By ATP Staff

Top seed Jannik Sinner and defending champion Carlos Alcaraz will both play their opening Roland Garros matches on Monday, Day 2 of this year’s tournament.

World No. 1 Sinner will play Frenchman Arthur Rinderknech, who is No. 72 in the PIF ATP Rankings. The 29-year-old did beat Sinner in their lone clay-court meeting in Lyon in 2021, but the Italian leads their Lexus ATP Head2Head series 2-1.

Alcaraz will play Italian lucky loser Giulio Zeppieri, who replaced the injured Kei Nishikori on line 127 of the draw.

Day 1 play on Sunday will feature Lorenzo Musetti, Tomas Machac, Frances Tiafoe, Ben Shelton and Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard.
